title: Man Stabbed After Kidnapping 3 People
text:
Man Stabbed After Kidnapping 3 People Tools 
Story Created: Oct 7, 2015 at 4:15   7, 2015 at 4:21 PM CDT Related Content 
PADUCAH, KY -- A man who was stabbed September 30 is now in jail. Paducah police say he kidnapped three people and threatened to kill them. Vernon Ward, 58, is accused of confronting a woman he knew, her son, and another young man with a gun. Police say Ward thought one of them stole his marijuana. Ward forced the two young men at gunpoint to go to the woman's house, then forced all three into his car. The victims told police, Ward threatened several times to kill them. Investigators say Ward pointed his gun at the woman. Her son then fought with Ward, pulled out a knife, and stabbed him in the neck and head. Ward crashed into another vehicle and all three victims got away. Police found the gun used in the kidnapping at Ward's home along with other drugs. Ward was treated at a hospital and was officially booked into the McCracken County jail on Wednesday. Investigators have charged Ward with three counts of kidnapping, first-degree wanton endangerment, tampering with physical evidence, possession of a handgun by a convicted felon, first-degree possession of a controlled substance (methamphetamine) and possession of drug paraphernalia.
